body: Please fix unit test first

@iqinning Hi, thanks for your contribution.

I think it would be better if we notify user after every 10 or 50 instances.

> If this is the case, it indicates that the user needs to set the number of concurrency to 17, so I think this is ok.

Maybe I didn't make it clear... 
Case 1 : run 20 threads to invoke dubbo service A (only system-defined filters) , set executes=10 on service A
Case 2:  run 20 threads to invoke dubbo service A (system-defined filters + user-defined filters) , set executes=10 on service A

We use dubbo-monitor-simple project  to monitor services. 
we find that even if  both cases have set executes=10, the dubbo-monitor displays the concurrent number  is 17 in case 2. In case 1, the concurrent number  is 10.
At first we think the settings , "executes=10" ,  didn't work in case 2.
Finally we find that the order between ExecuteLimitFilter and MonitorFiler affects the count of concurrent number
In case two, did the user-defined filter tamper with the value of executes?

> In case two, did the user-defined filter tamper with the value of executes?

no , the value of executes in ExecuteLimitFiler is still 10. Just  in dubbo-monitor-simple project, the number  displays as 17.

> > In case two, did the user-defined filter tamper with the value of executes?
> 
> no , the value of executes in ExecuteLimitFiler is still 10. Just in dubbo-monitor-simple project, the number displays as 17.

add zookeeper dependency like this and remove other zookeeper dependencies in your pom file maybe solve the problem
```xml
  <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.dubbo</groupId>
      <artifactId>dubbo-dependencies-zookeeper</artifactId>
      <version>${dubbo.version}</version>
      <type>pom</type>
      <scope>import</scope>
  </dependency>
```

According to [Single Responsibility](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-responsibility_principle) and Object Oriented Principle, `URLBuilder` is a tool to strengthen `URL`. That is `URLBuilder` is depends on `URL`. So, it is not a good idea for `URL` to perceive or depends on `URLBuilder`. Also, `URLBuilder` is tool to create such `protocol, username, password, host, port, path, parameters, methodParameters`. I don't think it is a bad smell.
fix in #7317

> Hi @wangchangbing @gudegg,
> Did you guys find out the reason why it is slow to transfer 3m data in local network with long connection?
> 220ms latency really surprised me...
> regards.

For Dubbo is not adopt to big data transfer. It use single long TCP connection for communication. If data is large, it will block connection, also, for single connection, is not a good idea to full use network. It might be better performance if you specify `connections` to a larger number.
For lower version is not support async generic call. It is impossible to make it work if consumer or provider not support it. Please try upgrade your provider version.
